title: Nunu "offmeta" ban.

replies.body:
All you needed to quote was

in his champ select lobby

I will die plenty for both of us
Yeah, thats real encouraging to hear, my teammate plans on dying alot
"People aren't playing the way I want them to, waaahhhhhhhhhh" - League of Legends Playerbase.

Ok, then please, by all means, play with me and i will play offmeta ap garen, or better yet, please play adc while i will leave you for the entire game as a "support". I will see how much you like that.
? I'd just pick karma or morg and 2v1 their bot lane ez.
Ah, so the team will not have an adc at all, and you somehow will magically win 1 vs 2. Good luck with that.
According to boards ADCs are shit anyway so why do we need one?
According to the boards, many things that are not true are true, your point?
My point is nothing really matters, so just play however you want as long as you are trying to win. Ignore the crybullies and move on.
Okay, i will play ap garen and "try" to win, i can't wait to see how that goes.

You are being difficult on purpose.

I can't say I have seen all of the guys games. But he apparently has or had a decent win rate at one point in diamond. (ignoring any winrate does not matter comment). 
If you could prove AP Garen to win, wouldn't you be upset when I say NO don't play your best champion.

It isn't like this guy is theorycrafting this and forcing it despite a 10% win. Your scenario is just trying to incite a fight.

Do you like your Galio support? What if everyone said NO don't do it. It sounds like you have other supports, but it still isnt a great feeling.

Those scenarios you posted sound bad. But a counterjungle strategy imo probably has the most value early game anyways. Once the other if gets some levels, easier clears,and can gank you are doing less to stall them.

Winrate has nothing to do with why this Nunu player is disliked by his teammates. It's that he's forcing a strategy on his team that they don't want to play by and, despite their objections, he implements anyway. He isn't effectively communicating because he just tells them what he wants to do and does it anyway, effectively shutting down anything his team says.

Again, it does not matter if the strategy works or not. It's whether he's a frustrating player to play with.

> [{quoted}](name=elduris,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-03-03T19:59:10.619+0000)
>
> Winrate has nothing to do with why this Nunu player is disliked by his teammates. It's that he's forcing a strategy on his team that they don't want to play by and, despite their objections, he implements anyway. He isn't effectively communicating because he just tells them what he wants to do and does it anyway, effectively shutting down anything his team says.
> 
> Again, it does not matter if the strategy works or not. It's whether he's a frustrating player to play with.

So if I am playing ADC and don't want an aggressive support/defensive support/Malzahar support/whatever else I don't want, but my support chooses it anyways, I can report him since he's forcing me to play a way I don't want to play?

You should understand there's a difference between "overall strategy" and "personal playstyle."

If you have a Malzahar support that stays with you during laning phase and helps you get gold to get your items, regardless of his personal playstyle (aggressive/defensive), his strategy is aligned with yours and you should have a fine lane.

If you have a Malzahar support that goes into the enemy jungle and never shows himself bot lane, then his strategy is not aligned with yours and your lane will suffer due to being 2v1.

Communication is key. If you talked to your support before the game and they told you they were not going to support you, you can either accept that and choose a solo laner, or you can say you want to play according to everyone else's strategy and ask him not to do that in this game.

The issue with the Nunu is that, regardless of his teams protests against this strategy, he does it anyway, and earns reports because he refuses to communicate. People are quick to say, "oh that means we can't deviate from the meta or we will be banned." and that's simply not true. You can absolutely deviate, but not at the expense of your team.

What I think a lot of people take for granted is the fact that the meta in terms of overall strategy has stayed consistent throughout most of League's life. You don't have to go into champ select saying "hey guys I'm gonna go a marksman bottom lane, can I get a support player to stick with me?" So people just assume now that the standard strategy applies to every game. When you try to apply that way of thinking to any off-meta strategy, it doesn't work as well. 

If you expect your team to accommodate your picks and your decisions, you should be willing to accommodate your team as well. This is not a one way street, this is a 5-way stop from hell that only proper communication and a willingness to work with the other 4 monkeys in your game can help you overcome.

> [{quoted}](name=elduris,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=000000000000000000000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-04T00:32:14.069+0000)
>
> You should understand there's a difference between "overall strategy" and "personal playstyle."
> 
> If you have a Malzahar support that stays with you during laning phase and helps you get gold to get your items, regardless of his personal playstyle (aggressive/defensive), his strategy is aligned with yours and you should have a fine lane.
> 
> If you have a Malzahar support that goes into the enemy jungle and never shows himself bot lane, then his strategy is not aligned with yours and your lane will suffer due to being 2v1.
> 
> Communication is key. If you talked to your support before the game and they told you they were not going to support you, you can either accept that and choose a solo laner, or you can say you want to play according to everyone else's strategy and ask him not to do that in this game.
> 
> The issue with the Nunu is that, regardless of his teams protests against this strategy, he does it anyway, and earns reports because he refuses to communicate. People are quick to say, "oh that means we can't deviate from the meta or we will be banned." and that's simply not true. You can absolutely deviate, but not at the expense of your team.
> 
> What I think a lot of people take for granted is the fact that the meta in terms of overall strategy has stayed consistent throughout most of League's life. You don't have to go into champ select saying "hey guys I'm gonna go a marksman bottom lane, can I get a support player to stick with me?" So people just assume now that the standard strategy applies to every game. When you try to apply that way of thinking to any off-meta strategy, it doesn't work as well. 
> 
> If you expect your team to accommodate your picks and your decisions, you should be willing to accommodate your team as well. This is not a one way street, this is a 5-way stop from hell that only proper communication and a willingness to work with the other 4 monkeys in your game can help you overcome.

It doesn't matter though. If I have found I don't mesh well with a particular support-regardless if it fits with the general strategy, based on what you've said previously-it doesn't matter if it works or not, it's based on if it frustrates the players he's with. If I don't like a particular support and they pick it anyways, by your own statement,  I can now report him. I can communicate all I want, but he can still decide to stay Malzahar.

Look, I get that it has a much different feeling to be left alone; but the same principles still apply. If we're allowed to report Nunu for playing a counter jungle style team support (vice ADC support), there's no different in my reporting Malzahar because I wanted a Soraka/lulu/Nami support.

You say it's ok to deviate so long as it's not at the expense of your team. At the expense of what, winrate? Their level of fun?

If it's the former, he's already proven through statistics that A)It doesn't cause the ADC to fall behind by much gold to warrant complaining about B)He has a higher win rate with his Nunu style than anything else; to the point where taking a standard support would be him WILLINGLY picking worse for the team as a whole.

If it's the latter, the same can be said of the team forcing him to play something he doesn't want to play. Most people hate playing support, yet the game tends to force you to play there anyways. Why is one players fun any more important than anothers?

As for your last paragraph...how is this supposed to work exactly? It's an odd case we're talking about. A player who literally is a one trick pony. He CANNOT play anyone else at the same level he plays Nunu. If his team accomodates him, they kind of have to go all the way, it doesn't work to half ass it. I understand what you're saying; teams should be working together and communicate, which I agree with-but in such an off the wall case with proven numbers, I find it hard to really say no to the guy.

And don't take this the wrong way, I've definitely had odd picks that pissed me off. However, those were guys who got put into support and effectively trolled, taking a complete off the wall pick that they've never tried before and truly screwing the game over. That is annoying.

I think most people are just too Meta-minded. They freak out when they see something different, to the detriment of the team.

> [{quoted}](name=Vectros,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-04T04:28:30.169+0000)
> It doesn't matter though. If I have found I don't mesh well with a particular support-regardless if it fits with the general strategy, based on what you've said previously-it doesn't matter if it works or not, it's based on if it frustrates the players he's with. If I don't like a particular support and they pick it anyways, by your own statement,  I can now report him. I can communicate all I want, but he can still decide to stay Malzahar.

Sure, but the point is he's still playing the role he was assigned. You can feel free to report him for whatever, but chances nothing will happen. Nunu however was reported in nearly 50% of his games, which is something I don't imagine a Malzahar support main achieving without being toxic.

> Look, I get that it has a much different feeling to be left alone; but the same principles still apply. If we're allowed to report Nunu for playing a counter jungle style team support (vice ADC support), there's no different in my reporting Malzahar because I wanted a Soraka/lulu/Nami support.

Alright, so let's take a look at the opposite then. If we're *not* allowed to report Nunu, what does that mean going forward? You can't be reported for not sticking to your assigned role in champion select? What then is to stop every mid main from just going to mid regardless of what role they get?

> Why is one players fun any more important than anothers?

All I want is for you to apply this line of thinking to both sides. Why is his fun so much more important than his 4 teammates' that we have to let him play this every game?
 
> As for your last paragraph...how is this supposed to work exactly? It's an odd case we're talking about. A player who literally is a one trick pony. He CANNOT play anyone else at the same level he plays Nunu. If his team accomodates him, they kind of have to go all the way, it doesn't work to half ass it. I understand what you're saying; teams should be working together and communicate, which I agree with-but in such an off the wall case with proven numbers, I find it hard to really say no to the guy.

So anyone who says "I only play X" should be catered to, or just him?

> I think most people are just too Meta-minded. They freak out when they see something different, to the detriment of the team.

This isn't about whether it's meta or non-meta. The issue here is his behavior to his teammates. Watch a few hours of his VODs then come back.

The whole argument defending him kind of falls apart when you try to apply it to literally anyone else, or any other circumstance. I see people reaching really far to justify this and some of the things I see being said around here would set a shitty precedence for League games and standards going forward. I hope that you take the time to try to apply your arguments to other situations instead of this one specific player, and see if it still makes sense.

> [{quoted}](name=elduris,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-04T05:15:02.428+0000)
>
> Sure, but the point is he's still playing the role he was assigned. You can feel free to report him for whatever, but chances nothing will happen. Nunu however was reported in nearly 50% of his games, which is something I don't imagine a Malzahar support main achieving without being toxic.
> 
> Alright, so let's take a look at the opposite then. If we're *not* allowed to report Nunu, what does that mean going forward? You can't be reported for not sticking to your assigned role in champion select? What then is to stop every mid main from just going to mid regardless of what role they get?
> 
> All I want is for you to apply this line of thinking to both sides. Why is his fun so much more important than his 4 teammates' that we have to let him play this every game?
> 
> So anyone who says "I only play X" should be catered to, or just him?
> 
> This isn't about whether it's meta or non-meta. The issue here is his behavior to his teammates. Watch a few hours of his VODs then come back.
> 
> The whole argument defending him kind of falls apart when you try to apply it to literally anyone else, or any other circumstance. I see people reaching really far to justify this and some of the things I see being said around here would set a shitty precedence for League games and standards going forward. I hope that you take the time to try to apply your arguments to other situations instead of this one specific player, and see if it still makes sense.

First off, the amount of reports shouldn't matter, the authenticity should. I can report someone all I want, but if it isn't valid, it shouldn't mean anything.

Second, Nunu is arguably also playing the role he is assigned-just in a different manner. He's still supporting the team as a whole. He isn't trying to duo top or mid or something like that, he isn't hindering the team; he's supporting the team by roaming into the enemy jungle and getting them behind. Kinda like how a "normal" support would poke the enemy support and adc to keep them off his own adc, Nunu is poking the enemy jungle and ganking other lanes to get the enemy team as a whole behind. It's a different mindset, but has a rather similar result when you think about it....just most people don't think about it.

The fact that you say it like that tells me you think Meta should be enforced. If not, then what's wrong with a team-wide support? After all, the role he's taking is "support". Not ADC's bitch, not bottom support, support.

As for your next point, well, I already covered that. He isn't outright stealing his OWN jungle; he is invading the enemy and hitting other lanes.

I'd also like to point out the irony that Riot says they don't enforce the meta, yet before I even get to champ select I have to select a meta role. Doesn't have much relevance to this conversation, just something that struck me just now.

Now perhaps my understanding is wrong here, feel free to correct me if I'm wrong. But I believe it's generally the ADC that is upset-understandably so since they're the one most negatively affected. In which case, it's 1 players fun vs 1 other players fun and cancels itself out.

If I'm wrong on this, then I think the community really needs to look at itself and realize it needs to stop being a meta sheep-but I'll concede if this is the case, yes 4 players fun>1 players fun.

For your next question; if its turns out it's a legit case like this guy, where they will undeniably do FAR worse if they pick anyone else-yes, you SHOULD let them do it, or else you are actually harming your own chance of winning.

However I have a feeling who most people who might try to claim this aren't actually 1 tricks. I don't think this would be too difficult to decipher pre champ select; a simple lolking search can reveal his match history. He claims he only plays Riven support, but only has her as 4 of her last 20 games? Sorry, you did fine with others, don't try to pull that. Your entire history is Riven with a substantially high winrate? Ok, take her.

I haven't actually seen any of his VOD's yet, something I've meant to get around too due to some rumors I've heard about. It may or may not change my mind; I'm not 100% concrete on the issue and only speak of what I've learned.
My guess is you lose match until your mmr levels out at a point where ap garen is viable, likely somewhere in low silver to upper bronze.
as long as you try to win. do you main ap garen like this nunu player mains support smite coutner jg?

> [{quoted}](name=Maximum Morde,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-02-28T14:59:20.676+0000)
>
> "People aren't playing the way I want them to, waaahhhhhhhhhh" - League of Legends Playerbase.

Pretty sure you're just a troll, but...

This guy has shown it works, and it works well even at high level player. To the point where picking anything else would detrimental to his team; he can't play anyone else at the level he plays Nunu.

AP Garen literally would not work, because he has no ap scaling to speak of. Nunu is countering the enemy jungle and helping gank other lanes-and contrary to what you might expect, his bot lane doesn't fall too behind on gold, only a few hundred or so.

AP Garen would literally do nothing to contribute, that I can think of. That's the difference.

> [{quoted}](name=Vectros,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2017-03-01T05:00:38.587+0000)
>
> Pretty sure you're just a troll, but...

> This guy has shown it works, and it works well even at high level player. To the point where picking anything else would detrimental to his team; he can't play anyone else at the level he plays Nunu.
> 
> AP Garen literally would not work, because he has no ap scaling to speak of. Nunu is countering the enemy jungle and helping gank other lanes-and contrary to what you might expect, his bot lane doesn't fall too behind on gold, only a few hundred or so.
> 
> AP Garen would literally do nothing to contribute, that I can think of. That's the difference.

garen with {{item:3116}} is effective and contributes

> [{quoted}](name=Magical Player,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2017-03-01T06:13:54.445+0000)
>
> garen with {{item:3116}} is effective and contributes

What do you consider effective and contributing?

So you grab a Rylais 20 minutes in and give your team an aoe slow when you spin. 

There's probably 100 other ways to give CC that's far, FAR more effective if the slow is what you're trying to get out of it. Does it technically do something? Yes, but it's far from what I'd consider efficient or effective, and your contribution would literally be "slow the enemy for a bit". If all you're building is AP, none of it will scale with abilities and goes to waste.

> [{quoted}](name=Vectros,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2017-03-02T17:22:44.661+0000)
>
> What do you consider effective and contributing?
> 
> So you grab a Rylais 20 minutes in and give your team an aoe slow when you spin. 
> 
> There's probably 100 other ways to give CC that's far, FAR more effective if the slow is what you're trying to get out of it. Does it technically do something? Yes, but it's far from what I'd consider efficient or effective, and your contribution would literally be "slow the enemy for a bit". If all you're building is AP, none of it will scale with abilities and goes to waste.

Slow the enemy for 3 secs in an aoe, its item that serves its purpose effectively on garen
is it efficient no, but I never claimed it was

> [{quoted}](name=Magical Player,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=00000001000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-02T19:49:03.040+0000)
>
> Slow the enemy for 3 secs in an aoe, its item that serves its purpose effectively on garen
> is it efficient no, but I never claimed it was

Still didn't answer my question. What do you consider effective and contributing? It's apparently not efficiency, and if that's the case, I can take pretty much any champion into any role with almost any item build-so long as there is some sort of effect from it, I am contributing, and that's all that matters.

> [{quoted}](name=Vectros,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-03T08:40:24.870+0000)
>
> Still didn't answer my question. What do you consider effective and contributing? It's apparently not efficiency, and if that's the case, I can take pretty much any champion into any role with almost any item build-so long as there is some sort of effect from it, I am contributing, and that's all that matters.


Effective and contributing
An item that has some use on a hero
example of not being eff/con mana regen on tryndamere
example of being eff/con life regen on tryndamere

IN theory yes, there is not 1 build path 
in general there are strong and weak build paths
in Practical there are a few build paths

So yes you can build {{item:3116}} on garen as it serves some function
is it the most efficent item you can build on him, no
but it does give him health and an aoe slow

> [{quoted}](name=Magical Player,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=0000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-03T19:16:47.040+0000)
>

> 
> So yes you can build {{item:3116}} on garen as it serves some function
> is it the most efficent item you can build on him, no
> but it does give him health and an aoe slow

Guess I'll start going taking Thresh support, but build Infinity edge amongst my items then. Ahri with Sunfirecape. Hell, I'll start putting Rylais on Vi too while I'm at it. Who cares that I already got built in CC, I'm slowing them too and got extra HP, never mind the huge waste of stats!

> [{quoted}](name=Vectros,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=00000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-03T21:37:54.071+0000)
>
> Guess I'll start going taking Thresh support, but build Infinity edge amongst my items then. Ahri with Sunfirecape. Hell, I'll start putting Rylais on Vi too while I'm at it. Who cares that I already got built in CC, I'm slowing them too and got extra HP, never mind the huge waste of stats!

Tank ahri is a thing.......
Again can it be built sure
is it effective to build sure
is it the best in slot? no, by no means is an item that doesn't maximize a heros kit best in slot

> [{quoted}](name=Magical Player,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=000000010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-03T21:59:10.761+0000)
>
> Tank ahri is a thing.......
> Again can it be built sure
> is it effective to build sure
> is it the best in slot? no, by no means is an item that doesn't maximize a heros kit best in slot

I'd like to know what competent player actually does tank ahri. I've never seen it played in a serious match, and I don't see why it'd be considered a good idea in the slightest.

I don't think you know what "effective" actually means.

Your AP Garen and Tank Ahri is like trying to dig a hole with your hands. Can you do it? Sure. Is it effective? No, it takes a while. You'd rather have a tool to do it.

Bruiser Garen/AP Ahri is digging a hole with a shovel. It's actually effective.

This is really the idea I've been trying to get you to understand from the get go. You *can* do a lot of things, that will have some sort of effect, yes...but it isn't actually EFFECTIVE to do those things. I mean, going back to my digging analogy, you show up to help dig holes for some plants, but don't bring a shovel. You might technically be "contributing", but the fact that you came without a shovel when you knew exactly what you would be doing that day is going to annoy the hell out of everyone else.

I think you misunderstanding
what effective and efficient mean
effective-successful in producing a desired or intended result.
efficient-Performing or functioning in the best possible manner with the least waste of time and effort. 
I never said ap garen I said{{item:3116}} 
tank ahri is a cc machine with aoe

> [{quoted}](name=Magical Player,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=00000001000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-04T06:07:04.388+0000)
>
> I think you misunderstanding
> what effective and efficient mean
> effective-successful in producing a desired or intended result.
> efficient-Performing or functioning in the best possible manner with the least waste of time and effort. 
> I never said ap garen I said{{item:3116}} 
> tank ahri is a cc machine with aoe

Ok, let's roll with the definition then.

Successful in producing a desired or intended result.

What is your desired result? To provide an absolutely minimal amount of CC? Then ok, you're effective.

Are you trying to be successful by actually winning the game? Then you aren't effective, because the ONLY thing you contribute is a slow...and again, arguably ineffective. Since you're trying to peel with said slow (or prevent an escape), you're applying a 20% slow in an area.

Hell, even if we say your goal is to just peel-not even win the game, I still wouldn't call it effecive. The chance that this will actually work and stop an enemy from reaching your ADC/team or getting away is fairly minimal, IE not successful, IE not effective, particularly when stacked against any sort of tanks CC. Even other bruisers have innate CC better than this.

So I originally said AP garen, you mention an AP item. The typical assumption then is we're talking about AP garen. I don't even know what you're trying to say now. Garen builds a Rylais, then goes full AD? Full tank? What?

In any case, if you're not talking AP garen, it's irrelevant anyways, since my post originally said AP garen.

But I'll humor you and say this; instead of building Rylais, build Randuins. It has everything you mentioned, and more. Nothing is wasted on it; you get a nice AoE slow, which is MUCH stronger that I might add; armor, and attack speed slow. You're far more resilient, and a 35% slow is enough I'd call it effective.

I'd just like to let you know though-the fact that you weren't actually talking AP garen when that's what the original post was talking about means this was a very pointless chain of posts.

It's an effective item
it performs a result 
it is not efficient
as you say Omens outclasses Ryalis

> [{quoted}](name=Magical Player,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2rUYfrOV,comment-id=0000000100000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-06T19:30:54.314+0000)
>
> It's an effective item
> it performs a result 
> it is not efficient
> as you say Omens outclasses Ryalis

Glad to see you ignored most my post. I see I'm just getting trolled, not going to bother responding anymore.
He has some bad decision making and he gets tilted like everyone does. He lost the first game at least by making poor calls, not because of what he picked.
Who says that the support is _**FORCED**_ to be bot lane? This guy supports his whole team putting the enemy jng to a disadvantage.

Who says the duo lane is forced to go bot. What if you got in with a duo that said "We are going mid/top and you are going bot" then refused to acknowledge any way that this was difficult for you to play around and when you got into game they went to your lane even if you were already there.

Sure some people would be down for the swap if they could find ways to make it work but if someone says "no thanks I want to go midlane, it will be difficult to escape ganks on my own" that should be enough for them to stop their strategy and not force it on their team.

Who says that when I get support, I have to support the ADC? Why can't I support mid? Or top? Or jungle? Why can't I follow the jungler around in case of invades? Why can't I support the team by being a moving ward walking around the map all game? "Support" isn't a lane after all, as long as I support my team that should count right?

Do you see how dumb that sounds?
